intro: Gilia eremica var. arizonica, commonly known as Arizona gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, adapting well to dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
